required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Global Study to Assess the Effects of MEDI4736 (Durvalumab) in Patients With Locally Advanced or Metastatic Non Small Cell Lung Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II,Non-comparative,Open Label, Multi-centre, International Study of MEDI4736, in Patients With Locally Advanced or Metastatic Non Small Cell Lung Cancer (Stage IIIB-IV) Who Have Received at Least 2 Prior Systemic Treatment Regimens Including 1 Platinum-based Chemotherapy Regimen

brief_summary.textblock: A study to assess the Effects of MEDI4736 (Durvalumab) in Patients With Locally Advanced or Metastatic Non Small Cell Lung Cancer in terms of efficacy, safety and tolerability

detailed_description.textblock: This study is designed to investigate the efficacy, safety, tolerability of a new drug, MEDI4736 (Durvalumab), in patients with Locally Advanced or Metastatic Non Small Cell Lung Cancer. MEDI4736 will be investigated in patients who have received at least two prior treatment regimens including one platinum-based chemotherapy

primary_outcome.time_frame: Responses recorded during 12 month treatment period
primary_outcome.description: Patients commenced treatment with durvalumab on Day 1 and continued on a Q2W schedule for a maximum of 12 months. Tumor assessments using computed tomography (CT)/magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) were performed at the times specified in schedule of assessments. Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors version 1.1 (RECIST 1.1) measurements as given by the ICR were used to derive the primary variable of ORR .

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Responses recorded during 12 month treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: Time to response (per RECIST 1.1 as assessed by the ICR) is defined as the time from the date of first dose until the date of first documented response (which is subsequently confirmed). TTR was only analyzed for Cohort 2.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time from response to progression, death, or last assessment
secondary_outcome.description: DoR (per RECIST 1.1 as assessed by the ICR) was defined as the time from the date of first documented response (which was subsequently confirmed) until the first date of documented progression or death in the absence of disease progression (ie, date of PFS event or censoring - date of first response + 1). DoR was only analyzed for Cohort 2. Cohort 2: Median DoR was 12.3 months in the PD-L1 high (TC>=25%) group at DCO (Q3 was NR). Of the 7 evaluable subjects, the median DoR was not reached in the PD-L1 low/neg group (TC <25%); therefore the DoR "number of participants analyzed" field has been entered as "0" and the DoR results field has been left blank.

intervention.description: MEDI4736 (durvalumab) by intravenous infusion every two weeks. Treatment from Day 1 for a maximum of 12 months or study drug withdrawal if this occurs earlier. Patients who achieve CR, PR or SD through the end of the initial 12-month treatment period can restart treatment with MEDI4736 (durvalumab) when they eventually do progress. This retreatment period can continue for as long as the investigator considers to patient to be receiving clinical benefit.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Aged at least 18 years.
- Documented evidence of NSCLC (stage IIIB/IV disease)
- Disease progression or recurrence after both a platinum-based chemotherapy and at least 1 additional regimen for treatment of NSCLC
- World Health Organisation (WHO) Performance Status of 0 or 1
- Estimated life expectancy of more than 12 weeks
- Patient's tumour sample must be PD-L1 positive (≥25%of tumour cells with membrane staining (Cohort 1 and 2) or PD-L1 positive with ≥90% of tumour cells with membrane staining (Cohort 3))
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior exposure to any anti-PD-1 or anti-PD-L1 antibody
- Brain metastases or spinal cord compression or unless asymptomatic, treated and stable (not requiring steroids).
- Active or prior autoimmune disease or history of immunodeficiency
- Evidence of severe or uncontrolled systemic diseases, including active bleeding diatheses or active infections including hepatitis B, C and HIV.
- Evidence of uncontrolled illness such as symptomatic congestive heart failure, uncontrolled hypertension or unstable angina pectoris.
- Any unresolved toxicity CTCAE >Grade 2 from previous anti-cancer therapy.
- Any prior Grade ≥3 immune-related adverse event (irAE) while receiving any previous immunotherapy agent, or any unresolved irAE >Grade 1
- Active or prior documented inflammatory bowel disease (eg, Crohn's disease, ulcerative colitis)

link.description: AstraZeneca Cancer Study Locator Service astrazeneca@emergingmed.com 1-877-400-4656

clinical_study.keyword: Locally advanced, metastatic, Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer, MEDI4736, Durvalumab, PD-L1

participant_flow.recruitment_details: First patient in: 25 February 2014; Last patient in: 28 December 2015 At the time of the 03 June 2016 data cut-off (DCO) for this clinical study report (CSR), 139 sites in 18 countries enrolled and screened patients and 101 sites in 16 countries treated patients. The study was conducted and managed by Quintiles, a contract research organization.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Patients with PD-L1 high locally advanced or metastatic NSCLC (Stage IIIB-IV) who had received at least 2 prior systemic treatment regimens including 1 platinum-based chemotherapy regimen were eligible. Patients were enrolled in 3 cohorts. The details are available in CSR section 5.1 and the inclusion/exclusion criteria description in section 5.3.

group.title: Cohort 1 (EGFR/ALK+)
group.description: consisted of patients who were EGFR/ALK positive and retrospectively or prospectively determined to be PD-L1 high (TC >=25%). In addition, the cohort included patients enrolled prior to Amendment 1 who were retrospectively determined to be PD-L1 low/neg (TC <25%) or PD-L1 status unknown.

group.title: Cohort 2
group.description: consisted of patients who were EGFR/ALK wild type/unknown and retrospectively or prospectively determined to be PD-L1 high (TC >=25%). In addition, the cohort included patients enrolled prior to Amendment 1 who were retrospectively determined to be PD-L1 low/neg (TC <25%) or PD-L1 status unknown.

group.title: Cohort 3 (TC >= 90%)
group.description: consisted of patients who were EGFR/ALK wild type/unknown and prospectively determined to be PD-L1 high (TC >=90%).

baseline.population: Baseline analysis was based on the safety analysis set, defined as all patients who received at least 1 dose of investigational product and for whom any postdose data were available.

group.title: Cohort 1 (EGFR/ALK+)
group.description: consisted of patients who were EGFR/ALK positive and retrospectively or prospectively determined to be PD-L1 high (TC >=25%). In addition, the cohort included patients enrolled prior to Amendment 1 who were retrospectively determined to be PD-L1 low/neg (TC <25%) or PD-L1 status unknown.

group.title: Cohort 2
group.description: consisted of patients who were EGFR/ALK wild type/unknown and retrospectively or prospectively determined to be PD-L1 high (TC >=25%). In addition, the cohort included patients enrolled prior to Amendment 1 who were retrospectively determined to be PD-L1 low/neg (TC <25%) or PD-L1 status unknown.

group.title: Cohort 3 (TC >= 90%)
group.description: consisted of patients who were EGFR/ALK wild type/unknown and prospectively determined to be PD-L1 high (TC >=90%)

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: AJCC staging at initial diagnosis
measure.description: Per tumour, node, metastasis (TNM) staging system as specified by American Joint Committee on Cancer. The staging is determined by a number of different parameters and the higher the staging the worse the prognosis for survival.

measure.title: Best response to previous therapy
measure.description: based on the last therapy received prior to entering the study

measure.title: Time from informed consent to first dose
Overall disease classification
measure.description: either patient has any metastatic site of disease or has only locally advanced sites of disease

measure.title: PD-L1 expression level
measure.description: % of tumor cells with membrane staining

measure.title: Smoking history
measure.description: Patients who checked options Cigarettes, Cigarillos, Cigars, Pipe Tobacco, or Tobacco for Smoking are considered smokers.

measure.title: Number of regimens of previous anti-cancer therapy

outcome.title: Objective Response Rate
outcome.description: Patients commenced treatment with durvalumab on Day 1 and continued on a Q2W schedule for a maximum of 12 months. Tumor assessments using computed tomography (CT)/magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) were performed at the times specified in schedule of assessments. Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors version 1.1 (RECIST 1.1) measurements as given by the ICR were used to derive the primary variable of ORR .
outcome.time_frame: Responses recorded during 12 month treatment period
outcome.population: The “FAS – evaluable for response per ICR” set, included all treated patients who had a baseline tumor assessment and had measurable disease at baseline according to the ICR.

group.title: Cohort 1 (EGFR/ALK+) PD-L1+ (>=25%)
group.description: consisted of patients who were EGFR/ALK positive and retrospectively or prospectively determined to be PD-L1 high (TC >=25%). In addition, the cohort included patients enrolled prior to Amendment 1 who were retrospectively determined to be PD-L1 low/neg (TC <25%) or PD-L1 status unknown. patients with PD-L1 TC>=90% are included in this group.

group.title: Cohort 1 (EGFR/ALK+) PD-L1+ (<25%)
group.description: consisted of patients who were EGFR/ALK positive and retrospectively or prospectively determined to be PD-L1 high (TC >=25%). In addition, the cohort included patients enrolled prior to Amendment 1 who were retrospectively determined to be PD-L1 low/neg (TC <25%) or PD-L1 status unknown.

group.title: Cohort 2 PD-L1+ (>=25%)
group.description: consisted of patients who were EGFR/ALK wild type/unknown and retrospectively or prospectively determined to be PD-L1 high (TC >=25%). In addition, the cohort included patients enrolled prior to Amendment 1 who were retrospectively determined to be PD-L1 low/neg (TC <25%) or PD-L1 status unknown. Patients with PD-L1 TC>=90% are included within the PD-L1 high (TC>=25%) group.

group.title: Cohort 2 PD-L1+ (<25%)
group.description: consisted of patients who were EGFR/ALK wild type/unknown and retrospectively or prospectively determined to be PD-L1 high (TC >=25%). group.title: Cohort 3 (TC>=90%)
group.description: consisted of patients who were EGFR/ALK wild type/unknown and prospectively determined to be PD-L1 high (TC>=90%).

measure.description: Patients commenced treatment with durvalumab on Day 1 and continued on a Q2W schedule for a maximum of 12 months. Tumor assessments using computed tomography (CT)/magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) were performed at the times specified in schedule of assessments. Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors version 1.1 (RECIST 1.1) measurements as given by the ICR were used to derive the primary variable of ORR .
measure.population: The “FAS – evaluable for response per ICR” set, included all treated patients who had a baseline tumor assessment and had measurable disease at baseline according to the ICR.

outcome.title: Time to Response
outcome.description: Time to response (per RECIST 1.1 as assessed by the ICR) is defined as the time from the date of first dose until the date of first documented response (which is subsequently confirmed). TTR was only analyzed for Cohort 2.

measure.title: Time to Response

outcome.title: Duration of Response
outcome.description: DoR (per RECIST 1.1 as assessed by the ICR) was defined as the time from the date of first documented response (which was subsequently confirmed) until the first date of documented progression or death in the absence of disease progression (ie, date of PFS event or censoring – date of first response + 1). DoR was only analyzed for Cohort 2. Cohort 2: Median DoR was 12.3 months in the PD-L1 high (TC>=25%) group at DCO (Q3 was NR). Of the 7 evaluable subjects, the median DoR was not reached in the PD-L1 low/neg group (TC <25%); therefore the DoR "number of participants analyzed" field has been entered as "0" and the DoR results field has been left blank.

reported_events.time_frame: Treatment emergent AEs observed up until 90 days following discontinuation of durvalumab or until the initiation of the first subsequent anticancer therapy following discontinuation of durvalumab (whichever occurred first).

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
